article: How to Prank Someone over Text
intro: Want to make your friends laugh? Prank phone calls are a thing of the pastâ€”now, itâ€™s all about prank texting. Sending a funny text to your friends is a great way to make everyone chuckle, especially if you canâ€™t see them in person. Weâ€™ve listed our favorite texting pranks below so you can

steps.title: Act like youâ€™re an annoying spam message to annoy a friend.
steps.subtitle: No one likes getting messages from bots!  a funny message that sounds like itâ€™s from a bot, then send it to a friend. If you really want to make this one believable, block your number before you send it to them. After a couple of bot messages, you can reveal to your friend that it was you all along.
sub-points: â€œThanks for joining CAT FACTS! With our new subscription service, weâ€™ll send you hourly updates about cats worldwide. To STOP, reply with STOP. Standard messaging rates may apply.â€
When your friend replies â€œSTOP,â€ keep the messages coming! â€œThank you for continuing CAT FACTS! Did you know that all cats have 4 legs and 1 tail? To opt out of these messages, reply, OPT OUT.â€
â€œWe are glad you are loving CAT FACTS! Cat fact of the day: All cats have fur, except for hairless ones. Reply STOP to STOP.â€

points.name: Sign them up for a text list.

steps.title: Annoy your friend with spam texts from random numbers.
steps.subtitle: Tons of comedians, celebrities, and even protest events have texting lists that you can sign up for online. Simply put your friendâ€™s number into the signup sheet, then wait for them to tell you about all the annoying messages theyâ€™ve been getting.
sub-points: To find a text list to sign up for, try searching, â€œComedy text listâ€ or â€œCelebrity texting sign up.â€
Try to wait until your friend complains to you about all the spam messages theyâ€™ve been getting before you reveal your scheme.

points.name: Act like you donâ€™t know who it is.

steps.title: Make your friend think that you lost their number.
steps.subtitle: Wait until a friend texts you, then say, â€œWho is this?â€ When they tell you who it is, keep the joke going with texts like, â€œHm, do I know you?â€ After a few messages back and forth, you can let them in on the joke.
sub-points: You could also say, â€œSorry, I donâ€™t know anyone named Jake.â€
Or, â€œWhatâ€™s your last name? Maybe that will jog my memory.â€
Or, â€œAre you sure you texted the right person?â€

steps.title: Sending lyrics will slowly confuse your friend until they catch on.
steps.subtitle: Pick a song that you like, like â€œHelloâ€ by Adele or â€œDonâ€™t Stop Me Nowâ€ by Queen. Then, send the lyrics line by line over text to your friend. If they still havenâ€™t caught on after an entire verse, you can tell them that it was just a joke!
sub-points: If you were using â€œDonâ€™t Stop Me Now,â€ youâ€™d start out by texting, â€œTonight Iâ€™m gonna have myself a real good time.â€
When your friend responds, keep going with the song. â€œI feel alive. And the world, Iâ€™ll turn it inside out.â€
If you were using â€œHello,â€ youâ€™d start out by saying, â€œHello, itâ€™s me.â€
After your friend responds, send them, â€œI was wondering if after all these years you'd like to meet.â€

points.name: Make up the definition for an emoji.

steps.title: Confuse your friend and make them doubt their emoji knowledge.
steps.subtitle: In the middle of a conversation, send your friend a super random emoji out of the blue. When they ask why you sent it, make something up. â€œOh, that one means â€˜I appreciate your friendship.â€™â€ If they push back, act super confused and like itâ€™s common knowledge. Once they believe you, tell them that it was just a prank!
sub-points: â€œThis one means that I like you, but only as a friend.â€
â€œYou donâ€™t know that emoji? It means that Iâ€™m having a super fun conversation with you.â€

points.name: Send a gif of the texting bubble.

steps.title: Make your friend think youâ€™re typing, even when youâ€™re not.
steps.subtitle: Search up a gif of the gray typing bubble, then send it to your friend. When they check their messages, it will look like youâ€™re crafting a super long, detailed message (even though youâ€™re not!). If your friend freaks out and asks why youâ€™re taking so long, you can tell them that it was just a joke.
sub-points: This prank only works if you and your friends both have iOS devices, so donâ€™t use this on anyone with an Android.

steps.title: Build the suspense to confuse your friend all day.
steps.subtitle: Randomly text your friend something like, â€œ10 hours left.â€ When they ask what itâ€™s for, tell them that theyâ€™ll see at the end of the day. Keep counting down every hour until the end of the day, and when they get to the end, reveal the big surprise: nothing!
sub-points: â€œ0 hours left. The end!â€
â€œTimeâ€™s up. The countdown was forâ€¦ Nothing.â€
â€œAre you ready for the end of the countdown??! Okay, big reveal: the countdown was for me to sayâ€¦. Hi.â€

points.name: Respond to a fake Facebook ad.

steps.title: Make your friend think they accidentally put up something for sale.
steps.subtitle: Text your friend and tell them that you saw their ad, and you want to buy whatever theyâ€™ve got. When they get confused, tell them that you appreciate them trying to haggle, but you know what itâ€™s worth. After a couple of messages back and forth, tell them that it was just a prank.
sub-points: â€œSaw your ad for the 2 llamas. Would you take $100?â€
â€œIs your momâ€™s minivan still for sale? Iâ€™d love to take it for a test drive.â€
When your friend gets confused, keep the joke going! â€œCâ€™mon man, I know youâ€™ve got the llamas. Just name your price.â€
â€œWow, I thought we were friends. Youâ€™re really not gonna sell me that car?â€

points.name: Send a worrying question, then donâ€™t reply.

steps.title: Your friend will wonder if youâ€™re okay with this funny prank.
steps.subtitle: Ask them a question that makes them pause, like what to do when a microwave explodes. Then, when they respond, stop answering their texts completely. After a couple minutes, once theyâ€™re good and worried, you can let them in on the prank.
sub-points: â€œCan you help me figure out how to use a fire extinguisher?â€
â€œLetâ€™s say, hypothetically, there was a goat inside my house. What should I do?â€
â€œIf my phone was smoking, should I keep texting people with it? Or no?â€

points.name: Tell them you have important info, then ghost them.

steps.title: Leave your friend feeling confused (and a little anxious).
steps.subtitle: Text your friend and tell them that you have huge news or something super time-sensitive that they need to hear. When they reply, stop responding altogether. After a few minutes (or a few hours, if youâ€™re feeling really mischievous), tell them that it was just a joke.
sub-points: â€œOMG I forgot to tell you this earlier. I have something super important to show you.â€
â€œText me back ASAP! I have something really important to tell you.â€
â€œCall me right now! This canâ€™t wait.â€

steps.title: If you can access your friendâ€™s phone, try this funny prank.
steps.subtitle: Grab your friendâ€™s iPhone and go to Settings > General > Keyboard > Text Replacement. Replace a common phrase they use with something super silly, like, â€œPecan Pieâ€ or â€œRub a dub dub.â€ When they try to text again, theyâ€™ll have a super hard time crafting a serious-sounding message. When they mention it to you, you can tell them about the awesome prank you pulled. Try shortcut changes like:
sub-points: â€œHiâ€ â†’ â€œI have a crush on you.â€
â€œLolâ€ â†’ â€œChicken nuggetsâ€
â€œOkâ€ â†’ â€œMooâ€
